alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Inland Brazoria (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:16PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fort Bend and central Brazoria Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Holiday Lakes, or 10 miles northwest of Angleton, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northwestern Angleton, Holiday Lakes, northern Bailey`s Prairie, Bonney and Brazos Bend State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
